infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian

Class EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian.EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian
extends java.lang.Object
implements EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate, java.lang.Cloneable

    Computes the differential entropy of a given multivariate set of observations (implementing EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate, assuming that the probability distribution function for these observations is Gaussian.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate, with:

    • The constructor step being a simple call to EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian().
    • The user can call setCovariance(double[][]) or setCovarianceAndMeans(double[][], double[]) instead of supplying observations via #setObservations(double[]).
    • Computed values are in nats, not bits!

    References:

    • T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991).
    • Differential entropy for Gaussian random variables defined at MathWorld
    • Multivariate normal distribution on Wikipedia
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

        public void initialise(int dimensions)

        Specified by:

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations(double[][] observations)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
        Set the observations for which to compute the PDFs for the entropy Should only be called once, the last call contains the observations that are used (they are not accumulated).
        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
        Parameters:
        observations - multivariate time series of observations; first index is time step, second index is variable number (total should match dimensions supplied to EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate.initialise(int)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - where the observations do not match the expected number of dimensions, or covariance matrix is not positive definite (reflecting redundant variables in the observations)

      • setCovariance

        public void setCovariance(double[][] covariance)
                   throws java.lang.Exception

        Set the covariance of the distribution for which we will compute the entropy.

        Note that without setting any observations, you cannot later call computeLocalOfPreviousObservations().

        Parameters:
        covariance - covariance matrix between the variables
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the covariance matrix does not match the dimensions supplied in initialise(int), is non-square, is asymmetric or is non-positive definite (i.e. there are redundant terms).

      • setCovarianceAndMeans

        public void setCovarianceAndMeans(double[][] covariance,
                         double[] means)
                           throws java.lang.Exception

        Set the covariance and mean of the distribution for which we will compute the entropy.

        Note that without setting any observations, you cannot later call computeLocalOfPreviousObservations().

        Parameters:
        covariance - covariance matrix of the variables
        means - mean of the variables
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - where the dimensions of the covariance or means are not correct, or the covariance matrix is non-square, is asymmetric or is non-positive definite (i.e. there are redundant terms).

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
        Compute the entropy from the previously supplied observations, or based on the supplied variance.

        The joint entropy for a multivariate Gaussian-distribution of dimension n with covariance matrix C is 0.5*\log_e{(2*pi*e)^n*|det(C)|}, where det() is the matrix determinant of C.

        Here we compute the joint entropy assuming that the recorded estimation of the covariance is correct (i.e. we will not make a bias correction for limited observations here).

        Specified by:
        computeAverageLocalOfObservations in interface EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
        Returns:
        the joint entropy of the previously provided observations or from the supplied covariance matrix. Returned in nats (NOT bits).

      • getLastAverage

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][] states)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
        Compute the local entropy values for each of the supplied samples in newObservations.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in newObservations (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).

        Specified by:
        computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in interface EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time-series for which to compute local entropy values (see EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate.setObservations(double[][]) for its format)
        Returns:
        an array of local values in nats (NOT bits).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
        Compute the local entropy values for each of the previously-supplied samples.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations.

        Specified by:
        computeLocalOfPreviousObservations in interface EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
        Returns:
        the array of local entropy values corresponding to each previously supplied observation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if setCovariance(double[][]) or setCovarianceAndMeans(double[][], double[]) were used previously instead of setObservations(double[][])

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Provide an implementation of the clone() method. This does not deeply copy all of the underlying data, just providing a copy of the references to it all. This is enough to protect the integrity of the calculator however if the clone is supplied different data (though the clone should not alter the data).
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        See Also:
        Object.clone()
